title: Understanding SQL Clauses
text: In SQL, the order of clauses is crucial for the query to execute correctly. Each clause has a specific role in the query processing.

title: The SELECT Clause
text: The SELECT clause is used to specify the columns that you want to retrieve from the database.

title: The FROM Clause
text: The FROM clause is used to specify the table from which to retrieve the data.

title: The WHERE Clause
text: The WHERE clause is used to filter records that meet certain conditions.

title: Order of SQL Clauses
text: Consider the roles of each clause: SELECT specifies columns, FROM specifies tables, and WHERE filters records. What is the correct order?
